ambition.question: Did my pursuit of success and influence in my career and personal life allow me to let my desire for power and dominance guide my decisions and treatment of others?
ambition.description: inordinate ambition and the obsession with power corrupts the soul by placing our desire to dominate and control above God's authority, turning us away from humble service and toward prideful self-exaltation.

extracted_data_phrases: in positions of authority or responsibility
ambition.question: Did I allow my desire for power and dominance to influence how I interacted with others in positions of authority or responsibility?
ambition.description: inordinate ambition and the obsession with power corrupts the soul by placing our desire to dominate and control above God's authority, turning us away from humble service and toward prideful self-exaltation.

extracted_data_phrases: for power and dominance influence my leadership decisions in personal and professional settings
ambition.question: Have I let my desire for power and dominance influence my leadership decisions in personal and professional settings, leading me to prioritize my own interests over serving others?
ambition.description: inordinate ambition and the obsession with power corrupts the soul by placing our desire to dominate and control above God's authority, turning us away from humble service and toward prideful self-exaltation.

greed.question: Did I make wealth and material possessions an object of my desire, leading me to prioritize them over my relationship with God?
greed.description: This sin makes money an idol that replaces trust in God's providence, turning what should be a tool for good into an object of worship.

greed.question: Did I make accumulating wealth, goods, and resources my ultimate goal in life?
greed.description: This sin makes money an idol that replaces trust in God's providence, turning what should be a tool for good into an object of worship.

extracted_data_phrases: through your words , actions , or decisions
oppression.question: Did you mistreat, harass, or discriminate against others through your words, actions, or decisions, showing contempt or disdain for their dignity and worth?
oppression.description: It's a sin to execute an unjust and cruel exercise of power or authority over others instead of respecting the God-given dignity of every human person.

oppression.question: Have I by my words, deeds, or silence allowed others to be mistreated or discriminated against?
oppression.description: It's a sin to execute an unjust and cruel exercise of power or authority over others instead of respecting the God-given dignity of every human person.

extracted_data_phrases: to what they could do for me ,
rather than seeing their full humanity
lust.question: Did I reduce others to what they could do for me, rather than seeing their full humanity?
lust.description: While not sexual in nature, this sin is still a form of lust in that it objectifies others who are created in God's image and possesses inherent dignity,

extracted_data_phrases: in my thoughts , words , and actions ,
rather than seeing them for who they truly are
lust.question: Did I reduce others to their usefulness in my thoughts, words, and actions, rather than seeing them for who they truly are?
lust.description: While not sexual in nature, this sin is still a form of lust in that it objectifies others who are created in God's image and possesses inherent dignity,

lust.question: Have I had actual or simulated sexual acts outside of a valid, sacramental marriage?
lust.description: While our sexual nature is a gift, using it to indulge in sensual pleasures is sinful as it's ordered for a particular purpose within marriage.

extracted_data_phrases: through my own actions or those that were made known to me
lust.question: Have I had actual or simulated sexual acts outside of marriage, through my own actions or those that were made known to me?
lust.description: While our sexual nature is a gift, using it to indulge in sensual pleasures is sinful as it's ordered for a particular purpose within marriage.

extracted_data_phrases: particularly through actions inspired by lust
lust.question: Have I had actual or simulated acts outside of marriage that objectify another person, particularly through actions inspired by lust?
lust.description: While our sexual nature is a gift, using it to indulge in sensual pleasures is sinful as it's ordered for a particular purpose within marriage.

envy.question: Have I ever felt resentful when others' successes seemed to overshadow my own accomplishments, causing me to secretly wish they would lose their advantages?
envy.description: Envy leads us to have discontent for another's possessions so we won't feel the pain of comparison or perceived lack in our own lives.

extracted_data_phrases: for what I have , often fixating on desiring others ' possessions in my thoughts
on desiring others ' possessions in my thoughts
envy.question: Have I been consumed by discontent for what I have, often fixating on desiring others' possessions in my thoughts?
envy.description: This sin stems from ingratitude for one's own blessings and letting material desires control our hearts.

incontinence.question: Did I lack self-control and speak to others with vulgar or inappropriate language, causing them to be offended by my words?
incontinence.description: This sin of incontinence shows a lack of self-restraint and violates the dignity of others.

extracted_data_phrases: with words that violated their dignity ,
particularly in informal settings where friendships are cultivated
incontinence.question: Did I lack self-control and speak to others with words that violated their dignity, particularly in informal settings where friendships are cultivated?
incontinence.description: This sin of incontinence shows a lack of self-restraint and violates the dignity of others.

extracted_data_phrases: in eating or drinking beyond what 's reasonable

gluttony.question: Did I overindulge in eating or drinking beyond what's reasonable, leading to an excessive attachment to worldly pleasures?
gluttony.description: This sin of gluttony demonstrates an inordinate attachment to worldly pleasures and rejects the call to temperance.

extracted_data_phrases: in eating or drinking beyond what is reasonable
gluttony.question: Did I overindulge in eating or drinking beyond what is reasonable, neglecting my commitment to self-control and moderation?
gluttony.description: This sin of gluttony demonstrates an inordinate attachment to worldly pleasures and rejects the call to temperance.

extracted_data_phrases: over my financial prudence and family obligations
prodigality.question: Have I excessive and wasteful gambling taken precedence over my financial prudence and family obligations, recklessly risking resources entrusted to me?
prodigality.description: This sin violates the virtue of stewardship by recklessly risking resources God has entrusted to us, while potentially harming our ability to provide for family and those in need.

prodigality.question: Have I excessively risked financial resources entrusted to me, prioritizing them over my responsibilities and needs?
prodigality.description: This sin violates the virtue of stewardship by recklessly risking resources God has entrusted to us, while potentially harming our ability to provide for family and those in need.

gossip.question: Have I derived pleasure from sharing others' private affairs, even if what I shared was true?
gossip.description: Gossip violates human dignity and charity by harming others' reputations for our own entertainment or pride.

gossip.question: Have I spoken words that brought pleasure to others by exposing their private affairs, even if what was shared was true?
gossip.description: Gossip violates human dignity and charity by harming others' reputations for our own entertainment or pride.

gossip.description: Gossip violates human dignity and charity by harming others' reputations for our own entertainment or pride.

extracted_data_phrases: on days when otherwise could have been avoided
impiety.question: Have I worked on days when otherwise could have been avoided, especially on Sundays?
impiety.description: It's irreverent to work on a Sunday as it's a holy day of rest, worship, and a day of protest against the servitude of work and the worship of money (CCC).

impiety.description: This sin is in failing to show proper reverence demonstrates a lack of faith, respect, and proper worship due to God.

impiety.description: This sin is in failing to show proper reverence demonstrates a lack of faith, respect, and proper worship due to God.

impiety.description: This sin is in failing to show proper reverence demonstrates a lack of faith, respect, and proper worship due to God.

impurity.question: Have you used practices, substances, or objects to prevent pregnancy?
impurity.description: This sin intentionally separates the unitive and procreative purposes of marriage and violates the proper use of one's sexuality.

extracted_data_phrases: in such a way that my attire was immodest
impurity.question: Have I dressed in such a way that my attire was immodest, reflecting poorly on me?
impurity.description: Wearing attire that's exceptionally revealing or indecent violates chastity and beckons sins from others.

extracted_data_phrases: in a way that shows disrespect for my dignity
impurity.question: Have I worn attire that beckons impurity in a way that shows disrespect for my dignity?
impurity.description: Wearing attire that's exceptionally revealing or indecent violates chastity and beckons sins from others.

impurity.question: Have I waywardly dressed in attire that is unbecoming to my dignity?
impurity.description: Wearing attire that's exceptionally revealing or indecent violates chastity and beckons sins from others.

fornication.question: Did I have any non-procreative sex outside of marriage?
fornication.description: While the sexual natures are a gift, it's a sin to stray away from their ordering toward the unitive and procreative nature within marriage.

fornication.description: While the sexual natures are a gift, it's a sin to stray away from their ordering toward the unitive and procreative nature within marriage.

violence.question: Have I knowingly acted in ways that brought pain or suffering to someone else through my words or actions during outdoor activities, hobbies, volunteering, or socializing?
violence.description: When we deliberately harm others, we attack their God-given dignity.

violence.description: When we deliberately harm others, we attack their God-given dignity.

extracted_data_phrases: towards someone who is committed to another person in marriage
adultery.question: Have I entertained inappropriate feelings towards someone who is committed to another person in marriage?
adultery.description: This sin undermines the sacred bond of marriage by treating another person as an object of desire rather than respecting their dignity and commitment to their spouse.

sorcery.question: Have I consulted mediums, fortune tellers, tarot card readers, or Ouija boards for guidance or advice?
sorcery.description: This sin is a violation of the First Commandment because it attempts to bypass God's providence and divine will by seeking supernatural knowledge through forbidden means, effectively placing trust in occult practices rather than in God.

sorcery.question: Have I consulted fortune tellers, tarot card readers, or Ouija boards for guidance on life's decisions?
sorcery.description: This sin is a violation of the First Commandment because it attempts to bypass God's providence and divine will by seeking supernatural knowledge through forbidden means, effectively placing trust in occult practices rather than in God.

extracted_data_phrases: without making any genuine effort to change
despite His call for conversion and growth
presumption.question: Did you deliberately persist in sinful behavior, assuming God's mercy without making any genuine effort to change, despite His call for conversion and growth?
presumption.description: Presumption of God's mercy is a sin against hope because it takes His forgiveness for granted without true repentance or effort to amend one's life, showing disrespect for divine justice and mercy.

extracted_data_phrases: in presuming that God 's mercy would always cover your mistakes , without making any genuine effort to change or improve

presumption.description: Presumption of God's mercy is a sin against hope because it takes His forgiveness for granted without true repentance or effort to amend one's life, showing disrespect for divine justice and mercy.

extracted_data_phrases: without making any genuine effort to change your ways , even when faced with familiar challenges and temptations
presumption.question: Did you deliberately persist in sinful behavior, taking God's mercy for granted without making any genuine effort to change your ways, even when faced with familiar challenges and temptations?
presumption.description: Presumption of God's mercy is a sin against hope because it takes His forgiveness for granted without true repentance or effort to amend one's life, showing disrespect for divine justice and mercy.

extracted_data_phrases: after having willfully neglected to go to confession for an extended period
presumption.question: Did you procrastinate confessing your sins to a priest after having willfully neglected to go to confession for an extended period, thereby delaying your reconciliation with God?
presumption.description: Deliberately delaying confession while in mortal sin is a serious offense because it recklessly endangers your soul's salvation, shows contempt for God's mercy through the sacrament of reconciliation, and demonstrates prideful presumption that you'll have time later to repent.

extracted_data_phrases: such as mortal offenses or sacrilegious acts
presumption.question: Did you put off going to confession when you knew you had committed serious sin, such as mortal offenses or sacrilegious acts?
presumption.description: Deliberately delaying confession while in mortal sin is a serious offense because it recklessly endangers your soul's salvation, shows contempt for God's mercy through the sacrament of reconciliation, and demonstrates prideful presumption that you'll have time later to repent.

extracted_data_phrases: either through internal thought processes or verbal expressions to others
apostasy.question: Have you explicitly rejected the existence of God, either through internal thought processes or verbal expressions to others?
apostasy.description: Denying God's existence after having been baptized apostasy is one of the gravest sins possible because it is declaring the Author of Life and Source of all being to be non-existent, which directly contradicts both reason and divine revelation.

extracted_data_phrases: either in your thoughts , words , or actions
apostasy.question: Have you explicitly rejected God's existence, either in your thoughts, words, or actions?
apostasy.description: Denying God's existence after having been baptized apostasy is one of the gravest sins possible because it is declaring the Author of Life and Source of all being to be non-existent, which directly contradicts both reason and divine revelation.

apostasy.question: Have you explicitly rejected the faith in God, either internally or to others through your thoughts, words, or actions, thereby denying the truth and goodness of His existence?
apostasy.description: Denying God's existence after having been baptized apostasy is one of the gravest sins possible because it is declaring the Author of Life and Source of all being to be non-existent, which directly contradicts both reason and divine revelation.

blasphemy.question: Did I take the name of Jesus or God in vain, speaking it irreverently or without reverence?
blasphemy.description: This is sinful as using God's holy name carelessly or disrespectfully shows contempt for His divine nature and fails to give proper honor to the sacred name of God, which should only be used in prayer, worship, or respectful discussion.
